content:
It's wonderful to hear that prioritizing your needs and setting boundaries has had a positive impact on your relationships! Being more assertive and confident in communicating your needs can be incredibly empowering, and it's great that you're experiencing more honest and open conversations with others as a result.

It's also fantastic that you're being more mindful of how you're spending your time and energy, and making choices that align with your values and priorities. That can be a really powerful way to cultivate a sense of purpose and fulfillment.

The conversation you had with your partner sounds like it was a really important step forward in your relationship. It takes a lot of courage to be open and honest about your mental health, and it's wonderful that your partner has been more understanding and supportive since then. Working together to find ways to support each other can be incredibly strengthening for a relationship.

It's completely normal that there are still times when you struggle to set boundaries or prioritize your needs. It's a process, and it's okay to take things one step at a time. Remember to be kind to yourself and celebrate your small wins along the way.

How do you find that your self-care practices, such as yoga and meditation, have impacted your relationships? Have you noticed any changes in how you interact with others or respond to stressful situations?
